question.text:
Fill in the blanks.

I. The Western Ghats have a greater amphibian diversity than the Eastern Ghats. This is an example of ____a_____ .
II. India has more than 50 thousand strains of rice. This is an example of ____b_____ .
III. Coral reef, mangroves and rain forests have greater diversity. This is the example of ____c_____ .

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mo>-</mo></math>  ecological diversity,  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>-</mo></math>  species diversity,  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>-</mo></math>  genetic diversity

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mo>-</mo></math> species diversity, <math><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>-</mo></math> genetic diversity, <math><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>-</mo></math> ecological diversity

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mo>-</mo></math>  genetic diversity,  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>-</mo></math>  ecological diversity,  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>-</mo></math>  species diversity

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mo>-</mo></math>  species diversity,  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>-</mo></math>  ecological diversity,  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>-</mo></math>  genetic diversity

solution.text:
Species diversity: This is the diversity observed at the species level. For example, the Western Ghats have a greater amphibian species diversity than the Eastern Ghats.

Ecological diversity: At the ecosystem level, India, for instance, with its deserts, rain forests, mangroves, coral reefs, wetlands, estuaries and alpine meadows has a great ecological diversity. India has more than 50,000 strains of rice, and this is due to the presence of different alleles in the rice population which renders the genetic diversity.
